ee.sk.digidoc
Class Signature

java.lang.Object
  ee.sk.digidoc.Signature
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Signature
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

Models an XML-DSIG/ETSI Signature. A signature can contain references SignedInfo (truly signed data) and signed and unsigned properties.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Veiko Sinivee
See Also:
Serialized Form

findCertValueWithSerial

public CertValue findCertValueWithSerial(java.math.BigInteger serNo)
Returns the first CertValue with the given serial number that has been attached to this signature in digidoc document. This could be either the signers cert, OCSP responders cert or one of the TSA certs.

Parameters:
serNo - certificates serial number
Returns:
found CertValue or null

                     throws DigiDocException

verify

public java.util.ArrayList verify(SignedDoc sdoc,
                                  boolean checkDate,
                                  boolean demandConfirmation)
Verifies this signature

Parameters:
sdoc - parent doc object
checkDate - Date on which to check the signature validity
demandConfirmation - true if you demand OCSP confirmation from every signature
Returns:
a possibly empty list of DigiDocException objects

verifyOcspOrCrl

public java.util.ArrayList verifyOcspOrCrl(SignedDoc sdoc,
                                           boolean checkDate,
                                           boolean bUseOcsp)
Verifies this signature. Demands either OCSP confirmation or uses CRL to check signature validity.

Parameters:
sdoc - parent doc object
checkDate - Date on which to check the signature validity
bUseOcsp - true if you demand OCSP confirmation from every signature. False if you want to check against CRL.
Returns:
a possibly empty list of DigiDocException objects

validate

public java.util.ArrayList validate()
Helper method to validate the whole Signature object

Returns:
a possibly empty list of DigiDocException objects

             throws DigiDocException
